Safe Mode is intended for users who cannot work out due to injury or illness. When Safe Mode is enabled, monster attacks do not occur.
Clears all workout data, goals, and activity preferences. Returns gameplay elements to a fresh install state.

Hello blank fragment
Add or remove activities from your current set.
Enter today\'s workout information.
Enter how much on average you currently do this activity per week.
Enter how much you want to do this activity per week, and in how many weeks you want to reach this level.
A member of your village has contracted and spread itching disease!
Boils. Everyone has boils.
A traveling prophet has foretold that the end is nigh. Some of the villagers flee.
Your village\'s water supply has been polluted.
An epidemic of the bubonic plague has spread to your village.
A mild drought has caused crops to perform poorly this month.
A blight of locusts has invaded your village and eaten through your crops!
A powerful storm has washed away valuable farmland and equipment.
The master thief Yuen Hsi has snuck into your village and stolen some food.
A family of dragons has burned through your crops.
A freakishly large and ferocious bear has rampaged through the village.
Bandits have raided your village and stolen valuable weapons.
A tribe of barbarians has attacked your village.
Your people favor Pacifism. They have dismantled some fortifications.
A neighboring kingdom has attacked your village.
Heavy rain has caused massive flooding throughout the village.
A lightning strike to a thatched roof has caused a fire to break out.
The housing bubble has burst. Families now face foreclosure and demolition of their homes.
Your village has a growing termite infestation.
A pack of giants has trampled through your village.
A virtually rodent-free enclosure. The perfect starter home for your village\'s families.
Are your villagers sick of sleeping on the floor in their huts? Try this compact, cozy dwelling featuring multiple rooms and mattresses.
Have you always dreamed of having horses and sheep right outside your window? This house is not equipped for stabling animals, but it\'s got plenty of rustic charm! And windows!
A country estate worthy of the finest nobles.
Now that\'s a big house. I bet you could fit a dragon in here. But maybe don\'t try that; not exactly fire-proof.
A whole field of wheat. Perfect for making bread. Peasants love bread.
A diverse patch of vegetables sure to keep your people healthy.
A place to keep your cows and sheep and horses. For milking? Shearing? Eating? You decide.
Mmm. Corn. Your villagers will eat this up.
What a beautiful way to spend the day - strolling through the apple trees with sun on your face... The villagers are going to love this place.
A basic siege weapon. Probably better for attacking than defending, but your villagers will take what they can get.
This may look like a pile of rubble, and it certainly is. But those heavy, jagged stones are more than a match for most human foes.
The tallest guard tower around! You\'ll see the enemy coming from miles away. Doubles as a panic room for the village.
Walls of weapons. Enough said.
More extensive walls of weapons. Plus solid rock walls lined with steel for good measure. Plus a library of military history!
